info.title: PurchasePlus API - Inventory Module
info.description:
Consists of the various locations that goods may be held, from physical ones to expense locations. On top of this the various transfer types may be performed to move goods around, and also stock takes can be undertaken.

The basic structure is that there are various types of locations which may hold stock levels. A stock level represents a product and its quantity and value. The quantity on a stock level is affected by transfers. History of the quantity and value of these stock levels over time is maintained through stock level balances. Transfers can be generated from a number of sources including requisitions, stock takes, and transfers between locations. A transfer has many items on it which record the product and quantity being transferred. From this it can be inferred the origin and destination stock levels being affected.

tags.name: Accounting Location
tags.description: A default location called 'Period-end Cost of Goods Used' for holding stock levels from cleared Expense Locations

tags.name: Accounting Transfer
tags.description: Created when expense locations are cleared

tags.name: Activity
tags.description: An audit log of activity on an object

tags.name: Adjusting Transfer
tags.description: Used when adjusting prices on products in a Stock Location

tags.name: Comment
tags.description: User entered notes against an object

tags.name: Department
tags.description: An organisational unit (purchaser or department within the purchaser)

tags.name: Derived Period Balance
tags.description: This is the balance for a stock level at the point of its most recent stock take

tags.name: Expense Location
tags.description: Used to track cost of goods sold

tags.name: Holder
tags.description: A holder is a representation of an entity that may hold stock

tags.name: Internal Requisition
tags.description: A requisition that is filled from an internal stock location

tags.name: Internal Requisition Line
tags.description: A line containing quantity and more for an internal requisition

tags.name: Internal Requisition Transfer
tags.description: A transfer created when an Internal Requisition is approved

tags.name: Location Period
tags.description: Represents the period between stock takes on a location

tags.name: Opening Location
tags.description: Used to initialise inventory

tags.name: Origin Destination Workflow
tags.description: Used on an internal requisition to control approval

tags.name: Product
tags.description: A product that represents stock that is counted and transferred

tags.name: Purchaser
tags.description: An organisation that purchases goods and services

tags.name: Receiving Document
tags.description: A document containing information on stock that has been received

tags.name: Receiving Document Line Item
tags.description: A line containing quantity received for which product

tags.name: Receiving Transfer
tags.description: Created when receiving goods from a Receiving Note

tags.name: Sale Expense Location
tags.description: Used to hold Point of Sale transfers when items are sold from a Stock Location

tags.name: Sale Transfer
tags.description: Created using Point of Sale data

tags.name: Stock Count
tags.description: A count of a single stock item on a stock take

tags.name: Stock Level
tags.description: Records the quantity, par level and value for a product

tags.name: Stock Level Balance
tags.description: Records the balance for a stock level after every event that may change it

tags.name: Stock Location
tags.description: A physical location holding goods and requiring stock takes

tags.name: Stock Take
tags.description: A collection of stock counts for a single stock location taken at a point in time

tags.name: Stock Transfer
tags.description: Records the transfer of stock between Stock Locations/Expense Locations

tags.name: Supply Location
tags.description: A location representing a supplier, used for Receiving Transfers

tags.name: Transfer
tags.description: Records a transfer between an origin location and a destination location

tags.name: Transfer Approval Workflow
tags.description: Describes the rules for the workflow to approve a Transfer

tags.name: Transfer Item
tags.description: A product on a transfer, recording the quantity transferred

tags.name: Value Adjustment
tags.description: A manual adjustment to the value of a stock level

tags.name: Variance Location
tags.description: Used to track variances between what exists in a stock take and what is in a Location

tags.name: Variance Transfer
tags.description: Used to clear any variances on a stock location due to a stock take

post.description: Creates a `Accounting Transfer` object that will describe the transfer information. The only possible destination and origin location types are Accounting Locations

This would be done after a stock take is completed. All expense locations that have non zero balance stock levels have transfers created that will move the stock into the default accounting location 'Period-end Cost of Goods Used'. This process will occur in the background asynchronously.

results.example: We are processing the clearing of all your expense locations to zero. Please check the Transfers section in a few moments to see if its completed.

delete.description: Deletes an accounting transfer object. If the transfer has already been completed it cannot be deleted. All items on the transfer will be deleted too.

post.summary: Create a comment for an accounting transfer
post.description: Creates a `Comment` object for the accounting transfer.
Cancel an accounting transfer. Must not be in the complete state.
Completes an accounting transfer. Must be in the open state. This will move all the items on the transfer from the origin location to the destination location.
Re-opens an accounting transfer. Must be in the cancelled state.

post.description:
Creates a `Adjusting Transfer` object that will describe the transfer information. The possible destination location types will depend on the origin location for the transfer.
Origin | Possible Locations
-------|-------------------
Stock Location | Variance Location, Opening Location
Expense Location | Variance Location
Opening Location | Stock Location
Supply Location | Stock Location, Expense Location

delete.description: Deletes an adjusting transfer object. If the transfer has already been completed it cannot be deleted. All items on the transfer will be deleted too.

post.description: Cancel an adjusting transfer. Must not be in the complete state.
Completes an adjusting transfer. Must be in the open state. This will move all the items on the transfer from the origin location to the destination location.
Re-opens an adjusting transfer. Must be in the cancelled state.

post.description: Creates a `Stock Take` object that will describe the stock take information. Stock Counts will be automatically built using the data from the Stock Levels in that stock location.
Find all stock takes that can be closed and close them. See the "Close a stock take" action for what makes a stock take closable.

example: We closed stock takes for all closable locations

delete.description: Deletes a stock take object. All stock counts on the stock take will be deleted too.

get.summary: Activities for the given stock take
get.description: Returns all activities (audit logs) for the given stock take.

first.description: Endpoint for the first page of data

last.description: Endpoint for the last page of data

prev.description: Endpoint for the previous page of data

next.description: Endpoint for the next page of data

post.description: Closes a stock take. In order to be closable the stock take must be in the open state (i.e. there is no `closed_at` set), and either a partial stock take or if not partial then there must be no stock counts that have a variance above 0. After closing a task will be scheduled that updates the Derived Period Balances for each stock level.

results.example: We closed the Stock Take for 'Beverage Store: November 2019'

post.description:
Creates a `Variance Transfer` object that will describe the transfer information. The possible destination location types will depend on the origin location for the transfer.
Origin | Possible Locations
-------|-------------------
Stock Location | Variance Location, Opening Location
Expense Location | Variance Location
Opening Location | Stock Location
Supply Location | Stock Location, Expense Location

delete.description: Deletes a variance transfer object. If the transfer has already been completed it cannot be deleted. All items on the transfer will be deleted too.

get.summary: Activities for the given variance transfer
get.description: Returns all activities (audit logs) for the given variance transfer.

post.summary: Create a comment for a variance transfer
post.description: Creates a `Comment` object for the variance transfer.
Cancel a variance transfer. Must not be in the complete state.
Completes a variance transfer. Must be in the open state. This will move all the items on the transfer from the origin location to the destination location.
Re-opens a variance transfer. Must be in the cancelled state.

id.description: JSONAPI ID of the derived period balance
Unique identifier for the derived period balance.

balance_quantity.description: The quantity of the stock level as at the final stock take for the `period`.

balance_value.description: The value of the stock level as at the final stake for the `period`.

is_deleted.description: Has this derived period balance been soft deleted.

location_id.description: ID of the location this derived period balance belongs to.

period.description: The period covered by this balance.

product_id.description: ID of the product from the stock level.

stock_level_id.description: ID of the stock level the balance is for.

id.description: JSONAPI ID of the holder
Unique identifier for the holder.

always_split_packages.description: Determines whether to split incoming packages into package units, e.g., pack of six  each of one

created_at.description: Timestamp when the holder was created.

organisation_id.description: ID of the purchaser this holder belongs to.

updated_at.description: Timestamp when the holder was last updated.

accounting_locations.description: Endpoint for the accounting locations within this holder entity

expense_locations.description: Endpoint for the expense locations within this holder entity

opening_locations.description: Endpoint for the opening locations within this holder entity

stock_locations.description: Endpoint for the stock locations within this holder entity

variance_locations.description: Endpoint for the variance locations within this holder entity

id.description: JSONAPI ID of the internal requisition
Unique identifier for the internal requisition.

approval_date.description: The date the internal requisition received final approval by a user.

approve_workflow_id.description: ID of the approval workflow assigned to this internal requisition. This controls how many approvals are required and who can approve this internal requisition. This will be set automatically upon creation.

cancelled.description: Has this internal requisition been cancelled by a user.

comments_count.description: How many comments have been added to this internal requisition.

created_at.description: Timestamp when the internal requisition was created.

department_id.description: ID of the department assigned to this internal requisition.

destination_id.description: ID of the destination location where the goods will be transferred to. The destination_id and origin_id must not be the same.

expected_delivery_date.description: The date the delivery of the goods is expected.

organisation_unit_id.description: ID of the owning organisation unit of this internal requisition. If there is a `department_id` it will be set to that, otherwise it will default to the current organisation of the current user.

origin_id.description: ID of the origin location where the goods will be transferred from.The destination_id and origin_id must not be the same.

origin_name.description: The name of the origin location. This will be set automatically.

purchaser_organisation_id.description: ID of the purchaser this internal requisition is for. Will default to the current purchaser of the current user creating the document.

requestor_id.description: ID of the user who created this internal requisition. Will default to the current user.

requisition_number.description: A unique number for the internal requsition. Will be automatically generated if not provided.

state.description:
The current state of the internal requisition. The valid values are
state | description
------|------------
`open` | The initial state for the internal requisition. May be submitted for approval or cancelled from here.
`awaiting_approval` | Requiring one or more approvals from users in the associated workflow. May be cancelled, approved or declined from here.
`approved` | The internal requisition has received all required approvals. At this point a transfer of the goods from the origin to the destination location is generated. May be closed or cancelled from here.
`declined` | All existing approvals are removed. May be submitted for approval or cancelled from here.
`closed` | Indicates the internal requisition is done with. No further state changes are possible.
`cancelled` | The interal requisition is cancelled. No further state changes are possible.

total_value.description: Before the internal requisition is saved this value is calculated based on the sum of the line totals.

updated_at.description: Timestamp when the internal requisition was last updated.

self.description: Endpoint for the internal requisition itself

activities.description: Endpoint for the activities of this internal requisition

comments.description: Endpoint for the comments added to this internal requisition

internal_requisition_lines.description: Endpoint for the lines added to this internal requisition

id.description: JSONAPI ID of the internal requisition line
Unique identifier for the internal requisition line.

available_quantity.description: The quantity available in the origin location. This will be populated automatically whenever an internal requisition is initially created.

count_units.description: Automatically set from the same attribute of the corresponding Stock Level on the destination location.

created_at.description: Timestamp when the internal requisition was created.

description.description: A cached version of the brand, description and sell unit for the product.
description.example: Evian Mineral Water : Still (Glass Bottle) [French] 330 ml bottle each of 1

internal_requisition_id.description: ID of the internal requisition this line belongs to.

product_brand.description: A cached version of the brand of the product

product_description.description: A cached version of the description of the product.
product_description.example: Mineral Water : Still (Glass Bottle) [French] 330 ml bottle

product_id.description: ID of the product on this line. Must be unique within the internal requisition.

product_item_measure.description: A cached version of the item measure of the product

product_item_pack_name.description: A cached version of the item pack name of the product.

product_item_sell_pack_name.description: A cached version of the item sell pack name of the product.

product_item_sell_quantity.description: A cached version of the item pack name of the product.

product_item_size.description: A cached version of the item size of the product.

quantity.description: A number representing the quantity required. This cannot be greater than the available quantity. Will automatically default to a value that brings the destination Stock Level to it's par level (if it has one set).

unit_price.description: Should be set to the `unit_value` of the corresponding Stock Level from the destination location.

updated_at.description: Timestamp when the internal requisition was last updated.

self.description: Endpoint for the internal requisition line itself

id.description: JSONAPI ID of the internal requisition transfer

predecessor_id.description: The ID of the internal requisition that produced this transfer.

predecessor_type.description: The type of internal requisition that produced this transfer.

reference.description: The document number of the predecessor.

self.description: Endpoint for the internal requisition transfer itself

activities.description: Endpoint for the activities of this internal requisition transfer

comments.description: Endpoint for the comments added to this internal requisition transfer

transfer_items.description: Endpoint for the items added to this transfer

id.description: Unique identifier for the location.

created_at.description: Timestamp when the location was created.

custom_sort.description: When set to true the P+ user interface will allow users to set the positioning of stock levels within the location.

is_deleted.description: Has this location been soft deleted from the system. When soft deleted the details are still available to appear on existing documents and so on, but this location cannot be used for anything new.

updated_at.description: Timestamp when the location was last updated.

id.description: JSONAPI ID of the location period
Unique identifier for the location period.

closed_at.description: Timestamp when this period was closed. Occurs when an Accounting Transfer is completed, or when all Expense Locations are cleared.

created_at.description: Timestamp when the location period was created.

date.description: The end date of the stock take period.

location_id.description: ID of the location this period belongs to.

open_at.description: Timestamp when this period was opened. Should be set to the close_at of the previous period.

updated_at.description: Timestamp when the location period was last updated.

self.description: Endpoint for the location period itself

id.description: JSONAPI ID of the opening location

self.description: Endpoint for the opening location itself

activities.description: Endpoint for the activities of this opening location

stock_levels.description: Endpoint for the stock levels of this opening location

id.description: JSONAPI ID of the origin destination workflow
Unique identifier for the origin destination workflow.

created_at.description: Timestamp when the origin destination workflow was created.

destination_id.description: The destination location that the workflow should apply to.

origin_id.description: The origin location that the workflow should apply to.

updated_at.description: Timestamp when the origin destination workflow was last updated.

workflow_id.description: The Transfer Approval Workflow that should be applied for internal requisition transfers between the origin and destination location.

self.description: Endpoint for the origin destination workflow itself

id.description: JSONAPI ID of the product

self.description: Endpoint for the product itself

id.description: JSONAPI ID of the purchaser

self.description: Endpoint for the organisation itself

holders.description: Endpoint for the holders owned by this purchaser

internal_requisitions.description: Endpoint for the internal requisitions owned by this purchaser

transfer_approval_workflows.description: Endpoint for the transfer approval workflows owned by this purchaser

id.description: JSONAPI ID of the receiving document
Unique identifier for the receiving document.

created_at.description: Timestamp when the receiving document was created.

destination_id.description: ID of the destination location when receiving into inventory.

organisation_unit_id.description: ID of the organisation unit that owns this document.

physical_date.description: The date the stock was physically received. May be different to both the received date and when this document was created.

purchase_order_id.description: ID of the purchase order associated with this receiving document.

received_date.description: The date that the receiving document was created. This date gets used

receiver_id.description: ID of the user who created this receiving document.

receiving_document_number.description: A unique number for the receiving document. Will be automatically generated if not provided.

stocked_at.description: Timestamp of when the receiving transfer was completed for this receiving document.

updated_at.description: Timestamp when the receiving document was last updated.

workflow_state.description:
The current state of the receiving document. The valid values are
state | description
------|------------
`open` | The initial state for the receiving document. May be received or cancelled from here.
`received` | Indicates the receiving document is finished. May be cancelled.
`cancelled` | The receiving document is cancelled. No further state changes are possible.

self.description: Endpoint for the receiving document itself

activities.description: Endpoint for the lines of this receiving document

id.description: JSONAPI ID of the receiving document line item
Unique identifier for the receiving document line item.

created_at.description: Timestamp when the receiving document line item was created.

description.description: A cached version of the brand, description and sell unit for the product.
description.example: Evian Mineral Water : Still (Glass Bottle) [French] 330 ml bottle each of 1

extended_price.description: The unit price plus tax amount for the product.

product_brand.description: A cached version of the brand of the product

product_description.description: A cached version of the description of the product.
product_description.example: Mineral Water : Still (Glass Bottle) [French] 330 ml bottle

product_id.description: ID of the product on this line. Must be unique within the receiving document.

product_item_measure.description: A cached version of the item measure of the product

product_item_pack_name.description: A cached version of the item pack name of the product.

product_item_sell_pack_name.description: A cached version of the item sell pack name of the product.

product_item_sell_quantity.description: A cached version of the item pack name of the product.

product_item_size.description: A cached version of the item size of the product.

purchase_order_line_item_created_at.description: Timestamp when the associated purchase order line item was created.

purchase_order_line_item_id.description: ID of the purchase order line item that was used when generating the receiving document line.

quantity.description: A number representing the quantity of the product received.

receiving_document_id.description: ID of the receiving document this line belongs to.

unit_value.description: The price for a single unit of the product excluding tax.

updated_at.description: Timestamp when the receiving document line item was last updated.

self.description: Endpoint for the receiving document itself

activities.description: Endpoint for the lines of this receiving document

id.description: JSONAPI ID of the receiving transfer

predecessor_id.description: The ID of the receiving note that produced this transfer.

predecessor_type.description: The type of receiving note that produced this transfer.

reference.description: The document number of the predecessor.

self.description: Endpoint for the receiving transfer itself

activities.description: Endpoint for the activities of this receiving transfer

comments.description: Endpoint for the comments added to this receiving transfer

transfer_items.description: Endpoint for the items added to this transfer

id.description: JSONAPI ID of the sale expense location

self.description: Endpoint for the sale expense location itself

activities.description: Endpoint for the activities of this sale expense location

stock_levels.description: Endpoint for the stock levels of this sale expense location

id.description: JSONAPI ID of the sale transfer

predecessor_id.description: The ID of the Point of Sale Sale that produced this transfer.

predecessor_type.description: The type of Point of Sale Sale that produced this transfer.

self.description: Endpoint for the sale transfer itself

activities.description: Endpoint for the activities of this sale transfer

comments.description: Endpoint for the comments added to this sale transfer

transfer_items.description: Endpoint for the items added to this transfer

id.description: JSONAPI ID of the stock count
Unique identifier for the stock count.

count_units.description: If the holder of the stock location has set `always_split_packages` to true then this will default to true. See the description of this attribute on `StockLevel` for more detail on what it means when set to true.

created_at.description: Timestamp when the stock count was created.

creator_id.description: ID of the user who created this stock count.

expected_quantity.description: The expected quantity that should be found in the stock location. Will be set to the balance quantity of the associated stock level.

opening_quantity.description: Will be set to the balance quantity of the associated stock level at the point the stock count is created.

product_id.description: ID of the product of the associated stock level.

quantity.description: The actual quantity found during the stock take.

stock_level_id.description: ID of the stock level that is being counted.

stock_take_id.description: ID of the stock take that this stock count is for.

unit_value.description: Will be set to the `unit_value` of the associated Stock Level when the Stock Take is closed.

updated_at.description: Timestamp when the stock count was last updated.

updator_id.description: ID of the user who last updated this stock count.

variance.description: Is the difference between the quantity and the expected quantity. Is set when the stock take is closed.

self.description: Endpoint for the stock count itself

activities.description: Endpoint for the activities of this stock count

id.description: JSONAPI ID of the stock level
Unique identifier for the stock level.

balance_quantity.description: The stock level quantity. This is updated as stock is moved in and out of a location.

balance_value.description: The stock level quantity multiplied by the unit value. This is updated as stock is moved in and out of a location.

count_units.description: If this is set to true then all calculations will use the `item_sell_quantity` as a multiplier. So a carton of 12 is considered as 12 units rather than 1.

created_at.description: Timestamp when the stock level was created.

is_deleted.description: Has this stock level been soft deleted from the system. It will not appear in any data that relies on stock level information.

location_id.description: ID of the location this stock level belongs to.

par_level.description: Represents the minimum stock quantity that should be on hand. The par level must be equal to or less than the reorder level.

position.description: If the location this stock level belongs to has `custom_sort` enabled then the stock levels will be ordered by this position attribute.

product_id.description: ID of the product this stock level is for. A product may appear only once for each location.

reorder_level.description: Represents the quantity at which point a re-order should trigger. Currently informational only. The reorder level must be greater than or equal to the par level.

unit_value.description: If the transfer item has a value for this when moving in then this value is taken and set as the new unit value, otherwise it is set as the balance quantity / balance value.

updated_at.description: Timestamp when the stock level was last updated.

self.description: Endpoint for the stock level itself

activities.description: Endpoint for the activities of this stock level

derived_period_balances.description: Endpoint for the derived period balances of this stock level

stock_level_balances.description: Endpoint for the stock level balances of this stock level

value_adjustments.description: Endpoint for the value adjustments of this stock level

id.description: JSONAPI ID of the stock level balance
Unique identifier for the stock level balance.

balance_value.description: The stock level quantity multiplied by the unit value.

created_at.description: Timestamp when the stock level balance was created.

event_id.description: The ID of the event that triggered the creation of this stock level balance.

event_type.description: The type of event that triggered the creation of this stock level balance.

stock_level_id.description: The ID of the stock level that this balance is for.

transfer_item_id.description: The corresponding transfer item on the transfer that triggered the creation of this stock level balance.

unit_value.description: The price of a single unit of the stock.

updated_at.description: Timestamp when the stock level balance was last updated.

self.description: Endpoint for the stock level itself

activities.description: Endpoint for the activities of this stock level

derived_period_balances.description: Endpoint for the derived period balances of this stock level

stock_level_balances.description: Endpoint for the stock level balances of this stock level

value_adjustments.description: Endpoint for the value adjustments of this stock level

id.description: JSONAPI ID of the stock location

self.description: Endpoint for the stock location itself

activities.description: Endpoint for the activities of this stock location

stock_levels.description: Endpoint for the stock levels of this stock location

id.description: JSONAPI ID of the stock take
Unique identifier for the stock take.

blind.description: When set to true certain screens and reports will not display the current quantity expected to be found within the location being stock taked.

closed_at.description: The timestamp of when the user closed this stock take.

closing_balance.description: Is the sum of the Stock Level Balances for the given stock location at the point this stock take was closed.

created_at.description: Timestamp when the stock take was created.

creator_id.description: ID of the user who created this stock take.

partial.description: If this is set to true then closing a stock take will not automatically close the associated Location Period for the stock location.

period_ending_on.description: The end date for the current period the stock take is occuring in. This will automatically be set to the last day of last month if the current date is less than half way through the current month (i.e. current day is 15 or less). Otherwise it will be set to the last day of the current month.

stock_location_id.description: ID of the stock location that this stock take is for.

updated_at.description: Timestamp when the stock take was last updated.

updator_id.description: ID of the user who last updated this stock take.

self.description: Endpoint for the stock take itself

activities.description: Endpoint for the activities of this stock take

stock_counts.description: Endpoint for the stock counts taken on this stock take

id.description: JSONAPI ID of the stock transfer

self.description: Endpoint for the stock transfer itself

activities.description: Endpoint for the activities of this stock transfer

comments.description: Endpoint for the comments added to this stock transfer

transfer_items.description: Endpoint for the items added to this transfer

id.description: Unique identifier for the transfer.

comments_count.description: The number of comments that have been added to this transfer.

created_at.description: Timestamp when the transfer was created.

creator_id.description: ID of the user who created this transfer.

destination_id.description: ID of the destination location for this transfer. This is where the goods were transferred to.

fault_message.description: If this transfer could not be completed then a message indicating why will be in this attribute.

origin_id.description: ID of the origin location for this transfer. This is where the goods were transferred from.

period_ending_on.description: The period this transfer occurs in. Set automatically when the transfer is created.

physical_date.description: The date the stock physically arrived in the location, it may be different from the date the transfer document was created. This is only applicable for physical stock locations.

state.description:
The current state of the transfer. The valid values are
state | description
------|------------
`open` | The transfer is in it's initial state, no transfer of goods has occurred yet.
`complete` | The transfer of goods from the origin to the destination was successfully completed.
`faulty` | The transfer had an issue, see the `fault_message` for detail.
`cancelled` | The transfer has been cancelled. This cannot happen once a transfer is completed.

transfer_number.description: An automatically generated identifer for this transfer.

type.description: Indicates what type of transfer this is.

updated_at.description: Timestamp when the transfer was last updated.

updator_id.description: ID of the user who last updated this transfer.

id.description: JSONAPI ID of the transfer approval workflow
Unique identifier for the transfer approval workflow.

approval_in_ranked_order.description: Indicates whether approval must occur in the ranks they have been specified, starting with the lowest numbered rank first.

created_at.description: Timestamp when the transfer approval workflow was created.

is_deleted.description: Has this workflow been soft deleted from the system. When soft deleted the details are still available to appear on existing documents and so on, but this workflow cannot be used for anything new.

owner_id.description: ID of the owning organisation of this workflow.

title.description: A user entered title for this workflow.

updated_at.description: Timestamp when the transfer approval workflow was last updated.

self.description: Endpoint for the transfer approval workflow itself

activities.description: Endpoint for the activities of this transfer approval workflow

id.description: JSONAPI ID of the transfer item
Unique identifier for the transfer item.

comments_count.description: The number of comments that have been added to this transfer item.

count_units.description: Automatically set from the same attribute of the corresponding Stock Level.

created_at.description: Timestamp when the transfer item was created.

creator_id.description: ID of the user who created this transfer item.

predecessor_id.description: ID of the artifact that was used to generate data for this transfer item.

predecessor_type.description: The type of the artifact that was used to generate data for this transfer item.

product_id.description: ID of the product being transferred.

quantity.description: The transferred quantity of the product.

transfer_id.description: ID of the transfer this transfer item belongs to.

unit_value.description: The price of a single unit of the stock.

updated_at.description: Timestamp when the transfer item was last updated.

updator_id.description: ID of the user who updated this transfer item.

value.description: The quantity multiplied by the unit_value.

self.description: Endpoint for the transfer item itself

activities.description: Endpoint for the activities of this transfer item

comments.description: Endpoint for the comments of this transfer item

stock_level_balances.description: Endpoint for the stock level balances of this transfer item

id.description: JSONAPI ID of the supply location

id.description: JSONAPI ID of the value adjustment
Unique identifier for the value adjustment.

balance_quantity.description: The balance quantity from the associated stock level.

comment.description: An optional comment to add to the value adjustment.
comment.example: Typo when entering unit price originally

comments_count.description: The number of comments added to this value adjustment.

created_at.description: Timestamp when the transfer item was created.

creator_id.description: ID of the user that created this value adjustment.

old_value.description: The previous unit_value from the stock level (prior to this value adjustment being created)

stock_level_id.description: ID of the stock level being adjusted.

unit_value.description: The new unit value to set on the stock level.

updated_at.description: Timestamp when the transfer item was last updated.

updator_id.description: ID of the user that last updated this value adjustment.

self.description: Endpoint for the value adjustment itself

activities.description: Endpoint for the activities of this value adjustment

comments.description: Endpoint for the comments of this value adjustment
